intro: Styloma martii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, tubular flowers are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators like birds and insects. Styloma martii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
